Text:
It's Clean, and legit ;)

So download this, or my parrot will bite you.
I've been looking for a copy of this for a long time.  Effing unicorn... Deckard was not a replicant.

Those who think that Deckard was a replicant, might find it interesting to read the book on which the movie was based. Although it's very different from the movie. The big question behind the story though, is the eternal question, of "what makes us human?".

And removing the narrative took something away from the great film-noir feel of the movie... The director's cut can burn in a very hot underground place...
This copy looks like a VHS.

The laser disc was copied from a vhs, because this version has still never been released to dvd. The only version that HAS been released to dvd in the U.S. is the directors cut. If you don't believe me, go look for it....    and rotsa ruck!

this is as clean as it was in the theatres, over twenty years ago, and the directors cut is crap.
If you don't like it, get bent :)

Loganxart, thank you so very much. I too check back often to make sure there is still someone here. Always very nice to see that someone is.
Here's how it went down, i was there :
A fellow brought over his "copy" of Blade Runner one night, and i managed to sit still for about 17 minutes before becoming determined to show everyone what this movie was really about. The next day i went looking for it. "Directors cut" was everywhere, and apparently the original had actually gone out of print. Every later release was "edited" in some way- and therefore the original had seemingly already been lost. even the "international cut" is slightly different. we eventually ordered it out of canada, black market rip to laser disc (ripped from VHS, yes primative!), we were personally assured the goods were proper- and they were. so to answer that question, I am the original ripper, and uploader. 
We used an actual full size laser disc player- it was a giant pain in the ass, it took about 4 days and six tries to get it right. only laser disc i ever ripped.  ...and if i have to, I'll do it again.

And thank you all very much for what you do. Encrypt your traffic...

-and as always-

Up Evil, DarkLittleApartmentStudios

Thanks for sharing! Fuck Ridley Scott and his George Lucas esque "Han Shoots First" revisions. This is the version I saw on TV during 80s. Its actually the International Cut, judging by the description on IMDB. 

A=8, V=6. The video hasn't been modified to give a full widescreen image on 16:9 monitors and TV's. Its widescreen inside a tiny 4.3 frame. Unless you still have a 4.3 monitor or TV, try another torrent.

I'm so glad to find this!  I never saw the original version, I came in with the Director's Cut.  Don't get me wrong, I quite like the Director's Cut and its' eerie silence.  However, I realize that I'm missing story, so I've always wanted to at least once HEAR Deckard's narration.

Thanks so much for you hard work!

darklittleapartmentstudio, this is precisely the version I prefer out of all of them and I appreciate this torrent. Thanks.

JayArgo - "Its widescreen inside a tiny 4.3 frame"

It's much simpler to say "Letterboxed".  It's normal for source materials that were produced before the advent of widescreen TVs.  The black bands at the top and bottom are "burned in", that is, they're part of the old style 4:3 image.  Full frame video contains the widescreen image between the black bands.  Normal... back then.
